title: Python Crash Course
author: Eric Matthes
description: Hands-on introduction to Python with practical projects (games, web apps, APIs).
why_read: Fast practical learning and projects you can show in portfolio.

title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python
author: Al Sweigart
description: Practical Python for automating everyday tasks — great for beginners.
why_read: Teaches real-world automation skills useful in backend scripting and tooling.

title: Fluent Python (selected chapters)
author: Luciano Ramalho
description: Deep dive into Pythonic patterns, data model, and advanced language features.
why_read: Once basics are done, helps write cleaner, idiomatic Python — valued by employers.

title: Building APIs with FastAPI
author: Antonio Melé (or similar FastAPI tutorial/book)
description: Focused resource on building modern Python APIs using FastAPI (auth, docs, deployment).
why_read: Directly applicable to backend internships that expect API development skills.

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications (selected parts)
author: Martin Kleppmann
description: High-level concepts of databases, scaling, and reliable systems (read relevant chapters).
why_read: Gives important system-design understanding for backend roles (read selectively).
